intro: Claoxylon wightii var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth claoxylon, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
